sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Consignment of Art Act.

sections.heading: As used in this Act, unless the context otherwise requires:
sections.text: As used in this Act, unless the context otherwise requires:

sections.heading: Any custom, practice, or usage of the trade notwithstanding:
sections.text: Any custom, practice, or usage of the trade notwithstanding:

sections.heading: (1) If a work of fine art is trust property under Section 2
sections.text:
when initially received by the art dealer, it remains trust property
notwithstanding the subsequent purchase of the work of fine art by the art
dealer directly or indirectly for the art dealer's own account until any
balance due to the artist from the sale is paid in full.

sections.heading: No property which is trust property under Section 2 or Section 3
sections.text: is subject to the claims, liens or security interests of the creditors of the art dealer.

sections.heading: (1) An art dealer may accept a work of fine art for commission
sections.text:
on consignment from an artist only if prior to or within seven days of
acceptance the art dealer enters into a written contract with the artist
which shall include but not be limited to the following provisions:

sections.heading: Any portion of an agreement which waives any provision of this Act is void.
sections.text: Any portion of an agreement which waives any provision of this Act is void.

sections.heading: Any art dealer who violates Section 5 is liable to the artist
(1) This Act shall not apply to a written contract executed
sections.text:
prior to the effective date of this Act, unless either the parties agree
by mutual written consent that this chapter shall apply or such contract
is extended or renewed after the effective date of this Act.
